news_header: Baltic States are disconnecting from Russian and Belarusian electricity grids and joining the European network.
news_original_title: Baltian maat irtautuvat viikonloppuna Venäjän sähköverkosta
news_text: Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania are beginning to disconnect from the Russian and Belarusian electricity grid. They will connect to the European electricity network via a link from Lithuania to Poland. The Soviet-era connection has helped maintain grid stability in the Baltic States, but since 2022, they have not purchased electricity from the east.
